What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback

Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List:
Strength: missing value topic is very helpful

Weakness: topics are not very coherent and some of them have already been covered in other courses

I think it's a overview of our two years study. Some of the topics are very helpful, such as missing variables, data analysis techniques, and some epi/clinical trials knowledge. I hope in the future it would strengthen the data technical analysis part.

The contents are definitively richer and more useful than that of fall semester.
The lectures around missing data are very practical.
The final project was well designed with real data.

However final project + final exam is a bit too much.
It'd be helpful to guide students to work on some form of healthcare claims data (eg. CMS limited data).
The courses are well-designed and instructors are super helpful. Learned a lot of practical things!

I don't think this course is necessary for BIS students. I feel like I didn't learn anything in the past two semesters. We were required to finish a final project. But we never know what is the right way to design an experiment or conduct data analysis for the final project.
Very poorly taught and not very useful

She is very clear in her lecture 
But as most of the parts on her notes are left blank for us to fill, I would recommend she to provide us with a copy of complete lecture note in case we missed anything

passionate, organized and easy to follow
actually there is no need to force class participation on simple questions just for the sake of asking questions; instead ask students meaningful questions which require more thoughts
Could be more supportive as a teacher
knowledgeable but ppt not informative, hope you can provide answers to questions in the ppt

clear

detail-oriented

Overview of two-year study before graduation.

practical course dealing with data in clinical setting
